data.text: @kcasey_c @voxdotcom Let's keep in mind that millions in the USA have no health insurance and therefore no prenatal care. It's no secret that the USA has an acceptably high maternal death rate.

@voxdotcom 😢

It wasnt a myth.
Hospitals filled several times during the pandemic.
Optimization has a cost, specifically in this case.
@voxdotcom Windham CT is a rural area yet this story tried to spin it racially. The majority of people affected are not minorities. Black pop in Windham is less than 7%

@NoLifeDGenerate @voxdotcom Ugh, you really don't know anything about giving birth, do you? C-sections aren't normally scheduled on demand. Maybe a few women can persuade an unethical doctor but 99% of the time there needs to be a medical reason for a c-section. C-sections are a hard recovery! Done it 4x

@voxdotcom Less maternity wards? OMG !!!

It’s no wonder though, given the extremely high infertility rates with Transgender women
@voxdotcom Where was her husband, the father? Isn't he part of the equation?
@kcasey_c @voxdotcom The baby went to a NICU suggests an early delivery.
@voxdotcom Next time schedule a fucking C-section. You want to fuck around doing things natural in modern times, that's the chance you take.

@voxdotcom Why are women & newborns not a priority? Why aren’t there at least midwives in rural communities and care provided for women’s health care? Why have #women’s health care been eliminated at hospitals! #WomenVote @WomenCount @LULAC @NAACP_LDF @HillaryClinton @SpeakerPelosi https://t.co/LFjpGitBUc

@voxdotcom This is a concern for all women & needs to be addressed at a national level.  How did we get to a point where women & newborns health isn’t a priority in America. 🤕 Where is Congress, where are the slots in medical schools for rural #OBGYN doctors? Legislators #women VOTE! https://t.co/LFjpGitBUc
